headline: Chinese Chicken Fried Rice
description: This chicken fried rice recipe is made with a colorful array of crisp vegetables and a bounty of rice with a scramble of eggs running throughout.

video.description: A quick chicken stir-fry with loads of crisp, colorful vegetables.
video.name: Chinese Chicken Fried Rice I

name: Chinese Chicken Fried Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until soft. Add cooked chicken and 2 tablespoons soy sauce; stir-fry for 5 to 6 minutes.
Stir in carrots, celery, red bell pepper, pea pods, and green bell pepper; stir-fry for 5 minutes. Mix in cooked rice until thoroughly combined.
Stir in scrambled eggs and 1/3 cup soy sauce; cook until heated through and serve hot.

review.reviewBody: A lot of work and it was very bland. I didnt even use all the rice the recipe called for. All I tasted was rice and soy sauce. Next time I want fried rice I will go get take out
We didnt like this as much as other recipes. I still like making my own Chinese food instead of paying over 30.00 at the restaurant for 2 people.
Was not a good recipe brown rice cooks way longer then it says it’s actually 45 mins
I used stir fried vegetables from Costco and added green onions, delicious!
Very good. Will happily make it again.

Pretty darn good. My wife and I recently went on a diet (we're blaming weeks of isolation) and thought Chinese food like this would just be something we really, really missed.

Them I discovered the miracle of using cauliflower rice and found it subs in nicely with this recipe.
It was Ok but kind of dry. Needed something to give it more taste.

Excellent and very tasty. Only added chopped garlic, a little garlic powder, fine ground malabar black pepper. Sometimes when I eat Chinese food, it feels as though it gets stuck in my chest, but not this one. Definitely a keeper!
Too much soy sauce but otherwise a fantastic recipe
It was very good and easy to make!!
I put ground beef and oregano basil leaves ..green onions instead of 1 large onion added potatoes and corn as a side
Yes and my son said that it was the BEST better than any restaurant that he has ever had.

This was great, add or don't add any leftover veggies you want. For everyone who re writes the recipe or makes a lot of changes - instead of 'reviewing' it that way - why not just add your recipe to a collection. It seems silly to review something when you've completely changed the entire thing

I didn't have enough sesame oil so I used fish oil
I omitted eggs and celery. I don't like celery or eggs in my Chinese food. I added seasoning salt and pepper

This was a pretty tasty dish! I substituted corn in place of the peas, and it was still great. I added some black pepper because it seemed a bit bland when I finished the recipe. I really enjoyed it. Wow, it makes a lot of food!!
I added some fresh crushed garlic.

Made this for dinner. Used sesame oil (1/2 T.), Italian green beans instead of snow pea pods - too expensive, plus added some seasonings that you can only find at Penzi's: 1/2 T. Berbere - nice kick, and about 1 T. of Bankok seasoning. Husband won't eat onion, so I used plenty of garlic. He loved it!
Used Olive Oil instead of sesame oil and it still was an awesome stir fry recipe !!!

Awesome Recipe! Added some more veggies like diced Brussel sprouts, broccoli, mushrooms, green onion and a drop of spicy sauce to the chicken while it was cooking along with some salt and pepper! Turned out amazing. Will definitely recommend.

My husband loved this which I was surprised about since he usually doesn't like Chinese food. I don't know if I will make it again though because you have to cook and chill the rice and cook the chicken prior to making the dish. I'm just usually too last minute for that thoughtful prep except once in awhile when I have time. Very tasty though!
Instead of all the veggies, I used up my frozen veggie mix. It was delicious, and would definality make it again.
Added a little bit of diced luncheon meat (Spam). Fast and easy to make, very DELICIOUS!!! Will make very often again and again.

Hard to believe, but I had never eaten Chinese Fried Rice before. When eating Chinese out we always ordered steamed. So, not knowing how it was supposed to taste, I didn't make any changes to the recipe, but I did make mine with leftover pork chops.
There isn't a picture, because my husband and finished it all between the two of us.
I will definitely make this again, but will try different meats or seafood.
Yummy
It was very good. Just a little to much soy sauce though. Good job

As others have said, this is a great basic recipe. I do recommend the following:
1-Add garlic- 
2-I don’t cook the food in sesame oil, but definitely use it to finish the dish- it adds great flavor.
3- I have made with both chicken and leftover pork, which turns out great.
4- scramble the egg separately, gently fold in right before serving.
Love it. I used steamed vegetables and it still turned out delicious.

This recipe was simple to follow and makes enough for many meals throughout the week. I can see why people suggest adding additional ingredients though, as compared to the typical Chinese dish, it can seem a bit bland. I'm curious to try this dish again with some additional ingredients.

Very good base; I added a clove of garlic, onion powder, fresh ground pepper and garlic powder for additional flavor per reviews I read. I also threw in some frozen peas. With my adjustments, my family loved it. Filling and delicous and served as a complete meal.
This is a great recipe! Only difference is that i waited the onions is some melted butter an chili oil. Everyone enjoyed this. I will definitely make again.
My friends and I loved it!
Made exactly as directed and it turned out good. I agree to make it great it needs added garlic and ginger

First time at making fried rice. Very good. I did not have peas, or peppers, but followed suggestion of 2 Tbsp butter and 1 Tbsp sesame oil. Put onion and garlic granules, garlic and ginger when cooked meat. Used only 3 cups rice. Added cashews. Yum. Also used 1/2 low sodium and regular soy sauce.
Good base start ... Added a lot to it based on other reviews
Very good. I used a frozen veggie mix of peas and corn that added a bit to the recipe. Came out very well. Comfort food!
A tasty affordable meal. Easy to make and you can add as much vegetables as you'd like.

I used the most helpful review in its entirety with these modifications; I used boneless, skinless chicken thighs and I used my food processor to chop finely. Skipped the sausage. Added frozen mixed vegetables and cooked the rice in chicken stock. My family liked it so much we ate the leftovers 3 days in a row! We used it as filling in lettuce wraps. AWESOME.
Loved it. Will do it again.
Great recipe! Wife can't have soy, so I used coconut aminos instead. Worked great!
Not very tasty. Don't recommend using cooked meat in fried rice. Mushy.
I make mine like Mary Tee suggested. But a good base recipe especially if your a new cook
It was awesome. Made a big batch for my wedding on July 29
I used thighs

Very good. I made it exactly as presented. Lots of vegetables and the chicken used was cooked in the crock pot first, so it was very tender. I forgot to get carrots so I had to use a can of carrots I had on hand. I will make it again, but next time I will use more soy sauce.

This recipe is ok. I use a lot more spices and also a chilipepper chopped in very small pieces. The fried rice will taste better, when you cook the rice one day earlier and put it in the fridge overnight so it is really cold.
Followed marytee's suggestions. Fantastic!
Yes I would make this again. I have added shrimp also added chicken. You could use riced cauliflower instead of rice. Guess what ? No Carbs. Delicious

I made this according to the recipe. Way to much Soy Sauce is used! Not only did it make the rice gummy it was like eating a mouthful of salt. Much to salty. Also, by adding the cooked chicken so early the chicken ended up overcooked.

I have made this dish twice so far. And actually, rather than following the recipe, I have followed MaryTee's instructions in her "Most helpful positive review" (I have just omitted the sausages though). And my oh my... It turned out awesome. Everyone came back for second helpings...
Bland but really easy I should have tried adding ginger and garlic.
Terrific! made exactly as written and it turned out delicious!

I have 3 people in my family with celiac disease. I love the use of rice flower and I just substituted the soy sauce with gluten free. Everyone loved it!! I will have to double the recipe next time!!!
Made it without the chicken and it turned out well.
This is a reasonably quick dinner. kids and husband fated it a 4 and said that I could make it again
fantastic recipe!!
We enjoyed every bite! Will make again.
NO
This tasted like it came from a can, sorry ....

This is a good recipe. It's great with a few modifications. I left out the bell peppers because to me they just don't seem to belong in stir-fried rice. I've made this twice now and it's delicious with these changes. Be sure to cook the rice the night before or morning of and refrigerate otherwise you'll have a sticky mess. Rice needs to be cold. I used 1 cup dry rice to get 4 cups cooked. That's all that will fit in my pan when I stir-fry. Be sure to not use any salt when cooking rice, because this dish will be salty enough from other ingredients. Also used 2 thick leftover pork chops cut into small pieces instead of chicken. First scramble eggs with 1 Tbs. water and cook flat in skillet with 1 Tbs. vegetable oil. Cook for 1 min., flip for another 30 seconds and roll up like a cigar and set aside. Chop into ribbons and then smaller pieces with spatula. Add 2 Tbs. oil to skillet and cook bias cut carrots 3 min; add bias cut celery and onion and cook 2 min; add 1 clove minced garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add 1-1/3 c. frozen peas (1/2 of 12 oz. bag) and cook 1 min.; add cooked meat you are using and cook 1 min. Add rice and sauce and stir to warm and mix (Sauce: 3 Tbs. oyster sauce, 1 Tbs. soy sauce, and 1 tsp. sesame oil stirred together.) Add 3-4 chopped green onions and eggs and mix to warm. Yum!

Good, especially considering it has so few ingredients. Because I made a lot, I had to stirfry the ingredients in batches and therefore needed to add more oil. I also suggest doubling the amount of chicken, since we could barely tell there was chicken in the recipe with the amount it called for. Fresh pineapple chunks would be a good addition. My family enjoyed this. I will make it again.
Pretty decent just needs more spices and vegetables but a great starter recipe.
Very good and healthy!
Very good!

We used (cold) brown rice, added a teaspoon of minced garlic and a half cup of diced carrots with the peppers, and added a half cup of steamed peas (instead of pea pods) at the very end. Definitely tasted healthier than our favorite takeout, but just as good.
This is very good, but I added a tablespoon of oyster sauce and fresh ground ginger too enhance the flavour, will be making this regularly.

I used the recipe except for using different vegetables that I had on hand. I've tried making fried rice before, and after trying this recipe, I realize that the sesame oil is a must for the correct flavor.

Yum! I've made this several times now. Used all advice from Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant gal. Sesame oil is a must. Cold white jasmine rice fries up the tastiest. Very adjustable recipe and adapts to what is on hand. Spam or chicken sausage cut into little pieces fries nicely too. Or meatless and use couple extra eggs.
I made it ahead of time and then baked it instead of frying and it saved time abd effort and turned out wonderfully
Thumbs up from the hubby and three kids, which almost never happens when we try new recipes. Omitted the celery and added broccoli - so yummy!! Also used basmati rice. Will definitely make again!

This was great! Cooking Chinese food is so hard and you have to go into it knowing it's not going to be perfect restaurant quality, but it was pretty close. I forgot a couple of ingredients (I'm the worst cook ever). I didn't use peppers or onion or egg. I used chicken, corn, broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed it and it was super easy to make!
Didn't make any changes, this was a hit for family and guess!
I used Teriyaki sauce and marinade instead of soya sauce and I added one small Granny Smith Apple chopped up in small pieces.
I added mushrooms and it was delicious. !!!!
Fantastic base for fried rice; did make a couple of small changes, frozen veggies, oyster oil. Will certainly make again. This was a lot better fried rice than I usually make.
I made no changes at all, it's an excellent recipe. Thanks so much.

I cooked the chicken first then added the onion & soy sauce, I saw no reason to add already cooked chicken when it only takes about 5-6 min to cook cubed fresh chicken. The recipe is very good and yes, I would make it again. I also used gluten free soy sauce to make a completely gluten free dish.
Really delicious fast and easy !
I Like
Both my wife and i love this dish. I do have to make it in 2 batches as she doesn't like the egg where as I love it. I've tried many fried rice dishes and this is my one and only now.
Great recipe to start out with, I used a few extra veggies. Children loved it!

Although it doesn't say how to cook the chicken, prior to mixing it together or alone.....we cooked the 3 mins on each side, then set aside and added them back in the step it says to add it. Also it doesn't mention to cook the rice 1st and let chill, since it should be added to the dish while it has been cooked prior also! A little play with it in one way or another is to us just part of cooking new recipes! Enjoy!!!

I'd have to agree with MaryTee. Read her review for helpful hints. This is a very good basic recipe. Food, like wine, is personal preference; recipes are merely a guide. Good cooks leave in what they like, take out what they don't have on hand or like, and substitute to their or their family's taste. The addition of garlic, oyster sauce and mixed vegetables takes this fried rice over the top in flavor.

This recipe was fun to make. The flavor and texture was very appealing. I would only make two changes. I used sliced scallions in place of the pea pods. Also, I will prepare the scrambled eggs in a separate pan from now on instead of trying to cook them in the same pan, as the video suggested. I would add the eggs last. Very enjoyable meal.
The fried rice was so so good! I would easily give this 5 stars but the directions were very unclear.
Look at Mary Tee's review , made adjustments and the meal was wonderful !!
A great all-in-one dish - lots of leftovers for work lunches.

this is soooo good! I use Kikkoman soy sauce, frozen peas & carrots, and sugar snap peas. 
The leftovers freeze just fine

I'm sure the recipe is delicious exactly as it's written, but I made a few changes based on what I had on hand and my past experience cooking fried rice. I did not use red bell pepper, pea pods, and green bell pepper. Instead I used shredded cabbage with the onions, carrots (my daughter doesn't like cooked carrots so I made sure they were just tender crisp... she ate them!), and celery. I coated the chicken with about a 1/4 tsp garlic powder, a 1/4 tsp onion powder, 2 tsp ponzu sauce, and 1 Tbsp hoisin sauce. I used low salt soy sauce in place of regular, and added a few chopped spring onions on top. Other than that (ha ha) I followed the recipe as written. Best fried rice ever!
This was very tasty. A little mushy, but I may not have cooked the rice enough.
I altered a bit using MaryTee's suggestions. Great recipe. A family favourite here!
Loved it ! So gooood

I took the advice from Marytee and it was delicious but instead I used chilled brown rice, 2 red peppers ( not a fan of green) snow peas and fresh peas. Everything else was the same. Tasted delicious and was over flowing with veggies the way my family likes it. Great recipe. Thanks for posting.
I changed it up a bit. I added bean sprouts, peas and carrots, cubed ham and chicken. Very good! Everyone loved it!
Delicious! Just what you want when you live no where near take-out!

I made this last night and my husband and I loved it. I used leftover rice, low sodium soy sauce and substituted frozen veggies for the fresh ones noted above. I didn't have chicken so I used uncooked strips of steak instead. The steak tasted horrible(not the recipes fault) but the rice was a show stopper. Next time I will double up on the rice because we were left wanting more.

I used about 3 cups brown rice for this cooked in vegetable broth (3 cups cooked). I also used fresh broccoli- 4 stalks, fresh sliced poblano and jalapeno pepper- unseeded, 1 onion- sliced, 4 cloves of sliced garlic, 1 10 oz. package frozen peas, 2 peppers- yellow and red, 3 cups chopped smoked turkey and 6 eggs. I cooled the rice down after I cooked it, then stir fried the broccoli in about 2 Tb. olive oil, then added the onions, peppers and garlic, added the turkey after that to warm, then added the peas. I put the rice in another pan, cracked the eggs over and stirred until scrambled. I added soy sauce, salt, pepper, adobo seasoning and cilantro sauce. I mixed altogether. Very very good- this is a forgiving recipe- add whatever meats or vegetables you like. It's a great recipe for Weight Watchers- it contains most of the power foods! Love it- and my husband does also- he is not even needing to lose weight:)

I made this tonight for dinner. Actually I prepped most of the stuff early in the day including cooking the rice. So the meal came together fairly quickly. I included all the ingredients except the pea pods. I used baby peas instead. And I used Rice Select Royal Blend with Red Quinoa....so glad I used this rice blend. And I didn't measure much of anything (as usual) and added some seasoning like Lawry's Seasoned Salt and some pepper. My hubby and I really loved this. And it made a lot even when I scaled it to serve two. Oh, yes, and I used EVOO instead of sesame oil...my preference in almost everything. Sal....you made us really happy! Thanks.
There's no sauce or flavor to it.
Easy to make with stuff I already had in the house.
